data.title: I have come to dedicate the rest of my life to you — Dr. Mohammad Sadiq
data.meta_description: Dulal Mia, Sunamganj In the election meeting held on Wednesday afternoon in the Palash High School grounds of Biswamberpur Upazila Awami League, Sunamganj-4 seat Awami League nominated candidate Dr. Mohammad Sadiq said, “I will not have any broker. I will do whatever is necessary to protect the interests of Dhopajan river workers. I will not […];
data.text:
Dulal Mia, Sunamganj

In the election meeting held on Wednesday afternoon in the Palash High School grounds of Biswamberpur Upazila Awami League, Sunamganj-4 seat Awami League nominated candidate Dr. Mohammad Sadiq said, “I will not have any broker. I will do whatever is necessary to protect the interests of Dhopajan river workers. I will not take any commission. Mohammad Sadiq did not come to the area to eat commission. I have seen the suffering of the area in the last one month and five days, people’s cries. I heard, I saw lamentations. I felt that I have done nothing in my whole life. I could not give real service to the people of my area. That’s why I took the new exam. If I can pass the exam by the grace of God and with your prayers, then I will work for you. I will never forget your love for me. You have bought me with love. Keep the doors of all your homes open for me. Any day I will come to your yard, sit on your porch, share your sorrows with me. The rest of me I am here to lay down my life for you.”

He also said, “We are moving ahead with the development and potential of a nation state of Father of the Nation Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina is dreaming of taking Bangladesh forward despite facing death 18 times.”

Addressing the chief guest at the meeting, District Awami League President Nurul Huda Mukut said, “Dr. Mohammad Sadiq is the pride and pride of the people of Sunamganj. We are the district Awami League now united. We are standing in a row and asking you to vote for the boat. We are Sunamganj-4 to the honorable Prime Minister. I wanted the party’s candidate in the seat, the leader kept his word. Now it is the responsibility of all of us to vote for Dr. Mohammad Sadiq on January 7.”

District Awami League General Secretary Noman Bakht Palin was the main speaker in the meeting. Bangladesh Awami League National Committee Member Barrister M Enamul Kabir Imon, Azharul Islam Shipper, Sadar Upazila Awami League President Abul Kalam, Hero Freedom Fighter Abu Sufian, District Awami League Leader Subir Talukder Baptu, Rezaul Karim Nikku, Manish Kanti De Mintu spoke as special guests. , Biman Kanti Roy etc.

Biswambearpur Upazila A.League president Benazir Ahmed Manik presided over and General Secretary Nurul Alam Siddiqui and former Vice Chairman Abul Kalam moderated the meeting, among others Dilip Kumar Burman, Biswambharpur Upazila Awami League General Secretary, Upazila Parishad Chairman Safar Uddin, Union Parishad Chairman Noore Alam Siddiqui Tapan, Sohail Ahmad and Milan Khan, party leader Suleman Talukder, Rafiqul Islam Talukder, Maram Ali, Rajesh Talukder, Khaled Mahmud Talukder, Roni Haque, Abul Kahar, Mobin Ahmad, Lutfur Rahman, Taibur Rahman, women leader Jannat Maryam and others.
